reviewText: When I purchased this I thought it was going to be just a plain old story of just quick bits and pieces of this and that.Guess what?It's very good as it counts down a very mixed bag of crimes and mysteries, some of this material is well not suited for children as crime scene photos are shown so parents be advised.Well done again Mill Creek on a top notch countdown.Highly recommended.
summary: A Good Countdown That Is Entertaining

reviewText: Another Mill Creek Documentary DVD Set that is worth the buy.  I bought this through another retailer but thought well enough of this to write a review.This provides 2 DVD's with 10 or so episodes.  On each of the so called "Mysteries", they present short snippets of information for each one of the so called "Mysteries".  While it is not always clear, it is presented in a very concise way.  So if you really want to research any of these, you can do so in a good fasion without to much a problem.Overall, this is a good buy & an interesting one to get.  Highly recommend

reviewText: I have a lot of Documentary on DVD. From Unsolved Mysteries to Cities of the Underworld I have a lot of DVDs about History, True Crimes and The Unexplained. Now I can say that I have found my All-time Favorite Documentary: "America's 60 Greatest Unsolved Mysteries & Crimes".This Documentary is amazing. The list of Mysteries/crimes featured on this DVD is really impressing:60. Where is Natalee Ann Holloway?59. Could Nicola Tesla's Greatest Invention Power the World for Free?58. Who Discovered America First?57. Did John Wilkes Booth Get Away with Murder?56. The Mystery of Ambrose Bierce55. Is Jim Morrison Dead?54. Was Marilyn Monroe Murdered?53. Joseph Smith and the Golden Tablets52. What is the Jersey Devil?51. The Mystery of Little Big Horn50. Who Whacked Bugsy Siegel?49. Who Fired The Shot Heard Round the World?48. The Philadelphia Experiment47. Who Bombed Wall Street in 1920?46. Was Apollo Eleven's Moon Landing a Hoax?45. Did Tom Horn Really Murder Willie Nickell?44. Where is the Treasure of Dutch Schultz?43. Were Sacco and Vanzetti Innocent?42. Will the Tylenol Murders Ever be Solved?41. Where Did Wisconsin's Eagle Diamond Come From?40. What Killed Harry Houdini?39. Who Killed Thelma Todd?38. Did Babe Ruth Call His Shot?37. Does Bigfoot Exist?36. Did Fatty Arbuckle Kill Virginia Rappe?35. A Bizarre Roswell Connection34. Where Are the Boston Heist Paintings?33. The Mysterious Death of Edgar Allan Poe32. Has Anyone Ever Escaped from Alcatraz?31. What Happened to Judge Crater?30. Who was the New Orleans Axeman?29. The Riddle of Native American Rock Art28. Where is Aimee Semple Macpherson?27. Did Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid Survive Bolivia?26. Where is James 'Whitey' Bulger?25. Why Did the Rosenbergs Have to Die?24. Who Pulled Off the St. Valentine's Day Massacre?23. What Were the Phoenix Lights?22. Was Sirhan Sirhan a Mob Assassin?21. Was Pearl Harbor Really a Surprise Attack?20. Who's Really Buried in Billy the Kid's Grave?19. The Lost Colony of Roanoke Virginia18. Is D.B. Cooper Alive ?17. What Happened to Jimmy Hoffa?16. Did Lizzy Borden Kill her Parents?15. The Curse of the Lost Dutchman Mine14. Who Killed the Black Dahlia?13. America's Masonic Conspiracy12. The Strange Mysteries of the Anasazi11. What Really Happened to Amelia Earhart?10. Who Kidnapped the Lindbergh Baby?9. What Caused the Salem Witch Hysteria?8. What's On Nixon's Missing 18 and Half Minutes?7. Did James Earl Ray Really Shoot Martin Luther King Jr.?6. Area 515. Who Lost the Civil War for the South?4. Who was the Zodiac Killer?3. Who Murdered JonBenet Ramsey?2. Roswell - Are We Alone in the Universe?1. The JFK Murder ConspiracyThe segments are between 5 and 15 minutes long. The narrator and the music are both great and add a lot to the quality of the documentary. The footage are great, everything is there ( including the gruesome pictures of The Black Dahlia and The Patterson Film ), the producers did a great job to find all the right footages/pictures for all 60 mysteries. And what's even better: This DVD is less than 10$ !! 7 Hours 38 minutes of great documentary for less than 10$; how can you go wrong ?? Do yourself a favor: Buy this DVD.

reviewText: If this is your first exploration into unsolved American crimes then you will most likely enjoy this DVD.  If, however, you are like me and have been reading about these cases for years then you will probably find it a bit boring.  It's not a bad compilation, just doesn't go deep enough for me.  Still enjoyable though.  Great introduction for someone just getting interested in the unsolved!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lots of great video and old film clips.Great myths discussed of new and old tales.The main problem with this documentary are the so-called 'experts' interviewed.Most are popular culture historians,and not police detectives.They have no more crediblity,than the average John Q. Public.Most of what they have read is already a shadowy myth based on a tall-tale.Rarely does the truth manifest itself this way.The dvd has lots of great eye-candy footage.With sixty mysterious crimes and events discussed,some topics are only quickly researched.Some of the featured stories are better than the others.One good one was the 'Jimmy Hoffa' story.It reveals Nixon's role in getting rid of Hoffa,because Hoffa knew about the Nixon-Mafia role concerning the assassination of JFK.In another episode,the eighteen minute gap on the 'Watergate' tapes,may have discussed the Cuban 'plumbers' and their role in the JFK assassination plot.Some weak stories ,the D.B. Cooper spot,does not even mention Kenny Christiansen.the Zodiac story doesn't mention anything of value to the case.The mob,political,lost treasure,missing persons,lost cultures,UFOs and civil war stories are all interesting.The most valuable story shows that obscure rocketeer ,Robert Goddard, was indeed patronized by the famed aviator ,Charles Lindbergh.And just as easy as a rocket can be built to ferry men to the Moon,it can also carry a nuclear warhead towards another nation.The Lindbergh kidnapping was discussed briefly,nowhere mentioned was 'J.J. Nosowitski'.The Italian workmen,Sacco and Vanzetti,may have also been framed by J.J.Nosowitski,however he again wasn't even discussed.But,many great legends are discussed here.The Thelma Todd,Marilyn Monroe,Black Dahlia and Fatty Arbuckle stories are Hollywood gossip classics.I hope they do a 'part two'.There are so many stories nowhere mentioned.No Loch Ness monster here?No Boston Strangler discussed?No Stonehenge mentioned?No Anastasia discussed?Just to name a few missed.
summary: Whodunit! Many excellent urban myths explored.

reviewText: I love to learn more about conspiracies and mysteries, when I saw this video on Amazon at first I was intrigued; 8 hours of entertainment. However what got to me is that it's only on 2 DVD's and the cost for this set was very low, especially considering that it just got released. I took a chance and bought it without high expectations.Well all I can say that I'm not disspointed, this appears to be a 10 part documentary that was produced for TV. Each episode is about 45 minutes long and features 8 stories. I admit that some of the stories are short and I would have loved to know more about it, but all in all it's a well produced production and the video quality is excellent. I recommend anyone who's into unsolved mysteries to buy it, and at this price you get more bang for your buck.
summary: Low priced but highly entertaining and worth it

reviewText: I should have known better, but I ignored the description on the box. Oh, dopey me.  There are 60 stories on 2 disks.  The details of any individual episode is so diluted as to be meaningless.  In fact, there are few details at all.  This is mostly a series of rhetorical questions that are supposed to call into question the official verdicts.One example:  "Did John Wilkes Booth get away with murder."  That's both the title of the program and the conclusion.  Booth was shot in the neck by Boston Corbett, a religious-crazy Union soldier at a Virginia tobacco barn.  There's just not much doubt about it.  There were many witnesses, too many to tell a unified lie.  Booth's companion, who was captured alive before Booth died, never contended that the dead man was not Booth.  Years later a charlatan in Texas, Finis Bates, wrote that a man had appeared in Texas, saying he was Booth.  Bates offered no credible evidence whatsoever and the man was now gone.  Then years later another man "confessed" on his deathbed that he was Booth.  His dried up corpse was displayed at county fairs and carnivals for decades.  Then it too disappeared.  And all this supposedly lends doubt to Booth's demise on the back porch of a farmer's house.  "Useless, useless," the dying man is reported to have said.  He was referring to his paralyzed hands, but he may just as well have been talking about this DVD set.There is no money or interest in claiming that Oswald slew President Kennedy, in proving there were no flying saucer crashes in Roswell, in proving that Marilyn Monroe died of a self-induced drug overdose, etc. etc.  Gullible people want to believe the highly unlikely and the virtually impossible.  If this is your bag, you'll like this offering.

reviewText: I think the list of the 60 greatest unsolved mysteries & crimes was very well made, had very good guest speakers, and was a great buy for the price. I agree with the list, there were some stories I hadn't heard of which made it more interesting to hear a new story. This is a great buy for anyone that loves those mysteries that remain unsolved throughout time.

reviewText: america's 60 greatest unsolved mysteries & crimes came out in 2010.  i am familiar with many of thesubjects mentioned.  since this item came out, one of the mysteries has been solved.  you'll have to watch it to see which one it is.  i was bothered by the segment about Joseph Smith who started The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints because it seemed disrespectful of this particular church.  younger viewers may not be familiar with some of the subjects mentioned.  judge crater is a good example.
summary: one of these mysteries is solved.

reviewText: Documentary meets Checkout-Line Tabloid.  We haven't gotten through all of them yet, but what we've seen has quite a few interesting facts spread thinly among repetition and dramatic hyperbole.  And of course "Unsolved" means that each one ends along the lines of, "we'll never REALLY know what happened to Judge Crater..."
summary: interesting to watch a few at a time
